title: Dragonstone bolts (e)

properties.name: description
properties.value: Enchanted dragonstone bolts are runite bolts tipped with enchanted dragonstone. Dragonstone bolts can be enchanted through the spell Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Dragonstone) by a player with level 68 Magic. The spell enchants 10 dragonstone bolts at a time. They require 61 Ranged to wield.

The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Dragon bolts (e)
"Dragon bolts (e)" redirects here. For the bolts from dragon metal, see Dragon bolts. However, for the enchanted version of those bolts, see Dragonstone dragon bolts (e).

Item ID9244

Enchanted dragonstone bolts are runite bolts tipped with enchanted dragonstone. Dragonstone bolts can be enchanted through the spell Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Dragonstone) by a player with level 68 Magic. The spell enchants 10 dragonstone bolts at a time. They require 61 Ranged to wield.

Enchanted dragonstone bolts have a 6% chance of triggering the Dragon's breath effect. This inflicts a dragonfire hit against the target, causing extra damage (visible ranged level * 20%). If the player boosts to achieve a Ranged level of 112, the extra damage is 22. If the target is immune to dragonfire, the special effect will not activate.

Enchanted dragonstone bolts are notable because of their effectiveness in PVP, with a chance of hitting extremely hard against opponents without antifire protection, as well as having a high ranged strength bonus. A player with 99 Ranged and using the appropriate boosts (namely Rigour, the Elite Void Knight equipment set effect, and a Ranging potion) can achieve a max hit of 70 with the special in PvP scenarios.

If the player has completed the Hard Kandarin Diary, there is a 10% increase of the likelihood that the special effect of an enchanted bolt will occur, resulting in a 6.6% chance instead. This effect is always active regardless if the headgear is equipped.

Dragon's Breath
A player activates the Dragon's Breath effect

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
4 January 2018
(update)

Renamed from Dragon bolts (e) to Dragonstone bolts (e) in order to prevent confusion with dragon bolts.

16 April 2015
(update)

Completing the Kandarin Hard Diary now increases the chance of enchanted bolt special effects activating by 10%, even without wearing Kandarin headgear 3.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

The chance of enchanted bolt special effects activating is increased by 10% wearing Kandarin headgear 3.

19 September 2013
(update)

Enchanted dragonstone bolts will now check correctly for anti-fire potions, prayers and dragonfire shields.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

18 June 2007
(update)

The item's value was increased from 1 to 1063.

[[File:Dragonstone bolts (e) detail.png|left|130px]]
'''Enchanted dragonstone bolts''' are [[runite bolts]] tipped with enchanted [[dragonstone]]. [[Dragonstone bolts]] can be enchanted through the spell [[Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Dragonstone)]] by a player with level 68 [[Magic]]. The spell enchants 10 dragonstone bolts at a time. They require 61 [[Ranged]] to wield.

Enchanted dragonstone bolts have a 6% chance of triggering the '''''Dragon's breath''''' effect. This inflicts a [[dragonfire]] hit against the target, causing extra damage (visible ranged level * 20%). If the player boosts to achieve a Ranged level of 112, the extra damage is 22. If the target is immune to dragonfire, the special effect will not activate.

Enchanted dragonstone bolts are notable because of their effectiveness in PVP, with a chance of hitting extremely hard against opponents without antifire protection, as well as having a high ranged strength bonus. A player with 99 Ranged and using the appropriate boosts (namely [[Rigour]], the [[Elite Void Knight equipment]] set effect, and a [[Ranging potion]]) can achieve a max hit of 70 with the special in PvP scenarios.

If the player has completed the [[Kandarin Diary#Hard|Hard Kandarin Diary]], there is a 10% increase of the likelihood that the special effect of an enchanted bolt will occur, resulting in a 6.6% chance instead. This effect is '''always''' active regardless if the headgear is equipped.
